item.title: Rainfall-Runoff Prediction at Multiple Timescales with a Single Long Short-Term Memory Network
item.description: New LSTM-based architecture for predictions at multiple temporal time scales.

item.title: Post processing the U.S. National Water Model with a Long Short-Term Memory network
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the potential of using the LSTM as a post-processor for the US National Water Model.

item.title: A Data Scientist's Guide to Streamflow Prediction
item.description: An introduction to hydrology and especially rainfall-runoff modeling, targeted at data scientists.

item.title: A note on leveraging synergy in multiple meteorological datasets with deep learning for rainfall-runoff modeling
item.description: In this paper we show the benefits of using multiple meteorological forcing products at the same time in a single LSTM-based rainfall-runoff model over just using a single product.

item.title: HydroNets: Leveraging River Network Structure and Deep Neural Networks for Hydrologic Modeling
item.description: Virtual presentation at the EGU General Assembly 2020 presenting the HydroNets architecture for modeling entire river networks.

item.title: Learning from mistakes: Online updating for deep learning models
item.description: Virtual presentation at the EGU General Assembly 2020 on data assimilation with LSTM-based models.

item.title: The performance of LSTM models from basin to continental scales
item.description: Virtual presentation at the EGU General Assembly 2020 comparing LSTMs trained for each basin individually with a single LSTM trained for all basins together.

item.title: Towards deep learning based flood forecasting for ungauged basins
item.description: Invited talk at the EGU General Assembly 2020 on using LSTMs for flood forecasting in ungauged basins.

item.title: HydroNets: Leveraging River Structure for Hydrologic Modeling
item.description: Modeling entire nested river trees by integrating the river hierachy into the neural network architecture. This manuscripts proposes HydroNets, an architecture designed for modeling multiple nested gauge stations.

item.title: What Role Does Hydrological Science Play in the Age of Machine Learning?
item.description: Opinion paper discussing the future of Hydrology, especially in the context of recent developments in Machine Learning

item.title: Streamflow Prediction with LimitedSpatially-Distributed Input Data
item.description: Workshop paper, investigating first ways of using LSTM-based models for climate change related questions in hydrology.

item.title: Using LSTMs for climate change assessment studies on droughts and floods
item.description: Workshop paper, investigating first ways of using LSTM-based models for climate change related questions in hydrology.

item.title: Large-Scale Rainfall-Runoff Modeling using the Long Short-Term Memory Network
item.description: Presentation at the AGU 2019 Fall Meeting presenting our recent results on large-scale hydrological modeling using LSTMs.

item.title: Machine Learning for Streamflow Prediction: Current Status and Future Prospects
item.description: Poster at the AGU 2019 Fall Meeting presenting Martins work on a model comparison study for the Great Lakes/Lake Erie area.

item.title: Toward Improved Predictions in Ungauged Basins: Exploiting the Power of Machine Learning
item.description: In this manuscript we test LSTM-based rainfall-runoff models on the task of prediction in ungauged basins and show, that a single LSTM-based model does better prediction in ungauged basins than a traditional hydrological model that was specifically calibrated for each basin individually.

item.title: The Proper Care and Feeding of CAMELS: How Limited Training Data Affects Streamflow Prediction
item.description: This paper investigates the influence of the number of training basins and the training period length on the model performance for the EA-LSTM and XGBoost

item.title: Towards learning universal, regional, and local hydrological behaviors via machine learning applied to large-sample datasets
item.description: In this manuscript we show for the first time how to train a single LSTM-based neural network as general hydrology model for hundreds of basins. Furthermore, we proposed the Entity-Aware LSTM (EA-LSTM) in which static features are used explicitly to subset the model for a specific entity (here a catchment).

item.title: Using large data sets towards generating a catchment aware hydrological model for global applications
item.description: PICO presentation at the EGU General Assembly 2019 on prediction in ungauged basins using LSTM based models.

item.title: Towards the quantification of uncertainty for deep learning based rainfall-runoff models
item.description: Poster presentation at the EGU General Assembly 2019 on uncertainty estimation using MC-Dropout and LSTMs.

item.title: Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks for rainfall-runoff modeling
item.description: Video presentation in CUAHSI’s 2019 Spring Cyberseminar Series on Recent advances in big data machine learning in Hydrology.

item.title: Do internals of neural networks make sense in the context of hydrology?
item.description: Presentation at the AGU 2018 Fall Meeting on experiments regarding the interpretability of LSTM states.

item.title: A glimpse into the Unobserved: Runoff simulation for ungauged catchments with LSTMs
item.description: NeurIPS 2018 workshop paper, showing first results on using LSTMs for prediction in ungauged basins.
